item.title: Indian and Chinese Premiers Pledge Cooperation on Border Issues
item.description: The prime ministers of India and China papered over their recent border dispute on Monday with a friendly joint statement and an array of promises.
item.dc:creator: By GARDINER HARRIS

item.title: World Brief | Middle East : Gunman Kills Four in Bank in Southern Israel
item.description: An unemployed former security guard shot and killed four people in a bank in the southern Israeli city of Beersheba on Monday.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: Musharraf Wins Bail in Bhutto Assassination Case
item.description: Pervez Musharraf, the former leader of Pakistan, won a court victory amid speculation that the military is trying to free him or return him to exile.
item.dc:creator: By SALMAN MASOOD and ISMAIL KHAN

item.title: U.S. and European Union Set to Negotiate Settlements in Chinese Solar Panel Cases
item.description: The plan that is starting to take shape would essentially carve up the global solar panel market into a series of regional markets.
item.dc:creator: By KEITH BRADSHER

item.title: After Benghazi, U.S. Pressing Ahead on Security Upgrades
item.description: The State Department is racing to fulfill recommendations on diplomatic security, but some Republicans have questioned its ability to carry out the changes.
item.dc:creator: By ERIC SCHMITT

item.title: Twin Bombings Kill 3 in Dagestan
item.description: The explosions in Makhachkala came the same day that Russian security officials announced that they had prevented a terrorist attack in Moscow.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW ROTH

item.title: Battle in Syria Pulls Hezbollah Further Into Assad’s War
item.description: Fighting in the strategic city of Qusayr saw rising casualties for the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah as it joined its biggest battle yet in support of President Bashar al-Assad.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD and HANIA MOURTADA

item.title: Global Health: 4 Germs Cause Most of Infants’ Severe Diarrhea
item.description: A study pinpoints just four microbes as the most common causes of severe and fatal diarrhea among the world’s infants.
item.dc:creator: By DONALD G. M cNEIL J r.

item.title: Wave of Attacks Kills Scores in Iraq
item.description: A series of explosions and gunfire assaults that left scores of people dead deepened concerns that sectarian tensions could trigger widespread fighting.
item.dc:creator: By DURAID ADNAN
item.media:description: People at the scene of a car bomb attack in the predominantly Shiite Kamaliyah neighborhood in eastern Baghdad on Monday.

item.title: Itineraries: Porter Airlines Hopes to Join the Jet Age
item.description: Porter Airlines’ plan to expand Toronto’s downtown airport, in part by filling in a bit of Lake Ontario, is raising tensions.
item.dc:creator: By IAN AUSTEN
item.media:credit: Chris Young for The New York Times
item.media:description: Robert J. Deluce founded Porter Airlines seven years ago.

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: May 20
item.description: Tibetans protest Chinese Premier Li Keqiang’s visit to India.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: A Tibetan man at a demonstration in New Delhi to protest the visit of Chinese Premier Li Keqiang. Mr. Keqiang is on a three-day visit to India, which hosts the largest population of Tibetan refugees.

item.title: Former Bank Executive in China Faces Bribe Accusations
item.description: The Communist Party has referred the case for a criminal investigation as it continues a drive to combat corruption.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: The Lede: Long Before Crack Cocaine Allegations, Toronto Mayor Was a Source of Controversy
item.description: Questions have been raised about Mayor Rob Ford’s conduct, temperament and public statements since his early days as a member of the Toronto City Council.
item.dc:creator: By JENNIFER PRESTON and LIAM STACK

item.title: India Ink: What’s So Big About ‘Big B’?
item.description: Amitabh Bachchan stopped being awesome a while ago, but it hasn’t affected the Idea of Bachchan, the author argues.
item.dc:creator: By SNIGDHA POONAM
item.media:description: Amitabh Bachchan, right, with actor Leonardo DiCaprio at the opening ceremony of the 66th annual Cannes Film Festival in France on Wednesday.

item.title: Lens Blog: Israeli Report Casting New Doubts on Shooting in Gaza
item.description: A new report by the Israeli government called into question a well-known image of a Palestinian boy and his father caught in the crossfire of a gun battle in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: India Ink: India and China Sign Deals on Economic and Cultural Cooperation
item.description: Close on the heels of a border dispute, the two countries signed eight new deals in New Delhi on Monday.
item.dc:creator: By NEHA THIRANI BAGRI
item.media:description: Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, right, with Chinese Premier Li Keqiang before a meeting in New Delhi on Monday.

item.title: IHT Rendezvous: Storm in a Dipping Bowl Over Europe’s Olive Oil Rule
item.description: Even the European Union’s supporters are suggesting that the alliance’s bureaucrats might have better things to do than tampering with the way olive oil is served in the Continent’s restaurants.
item.dc:creator: By HARVEY MORRIS
item.media:description: Olive oil on sale at Domaine de l'Oulivie in southern France.

item.title: Letter From Europe: In Litvinenko Case, Secrecy Wins Out Over Inquiry
item.description: A judge's ruling that evidence could be excluded at the inquest into the death of a former K.G.B. agent was arguably a triumph of official opacity in a struggle over what the public should be allowed to know.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL

item.title: IHT Rendezvous: IHT Quick Read: May 20
item.description: David Cameron’s woes; Afghan women’s rights; H&M in Bangladesh; study abroad and the safety factor; the Cohen brothers at Cannes; wind-limit questions at the America’s Cup.
item.category: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
item.dc:creator: By INTERNATIONAL HERALD TRIBUNE
item.media:description: A Kabul store selling burqas, a garment that has come to exemplify the many limitations faced by women in Afghanistan.

item.title: Bombing Kills Key Figure in Northern Afghan Province
item.description: A suicide bomber killed 14 people Monday in Baghlan Province, including Rasul Mohseni, who was widely seen as the most powerful man in the province.
item.dc:creator: By ROD NORDLAND

item.title: China Calls for North Korea to Release Fishing Crew
item.description: The owner of the Chinese vessel seized by North Korea voiced concern about the safety of the detained fishermen.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: North Korea Conducts Launchings for 3rd Day
item.description: The North has been firing short-range projectiles off its east coast since Saturday, leaving regional officials puzzled over its motives.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: Fresh Israeli Face Plays Down Political Decline
item.description: Yair Lapid, the popular television host whose political rise has been undercut by the austerity budget he presented as finance minister, is trying to take the long view.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN
item.media:credit: Rina Castelnuovo for The New York Times
item.media:description: As finance minister, Yair Lapid has presented an unpopular budget, undercutting the successes that made his party the second largest in Parliament.

item.title: IHT Rendezvous: Deciding the Future of the Arctic
item.description: The region holds an estimated 13 percent of the world’s undiscovered oil reserves and 30 percent of the world’s undiscovered gas. What should happen to it and who should say?
item.dc:creator: By CHRISTOPHER F. SCHUETZE
item.media:description: A whale dives into sea off the coast of Greenland's capital Nuuk. The remote fjord could be transformed if plans to mine for iron ore go ahead.

item.title: India Ink: India Arrives at the Arctic
item.description: Why does India’s inclusion as a permanent observer in the Arctic Council matter?
item.dc:creator: By KABIR TANEJA
item.media:description: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry sitting next to U.S. Senator Lisa Murkowski during the Arctic Council Ministerial Session in Kiruna, Sweden, on Wednesday.
